ygData.subject: RE: Nybright Sisters and taking the lives of our fellow man
ygData.msgSnippet: Brother Dornn, Aye,  yours is a most admirable goal and one that should be shared by all who seek personal balance. It has been my view that one cannot acheive
ygData.messageBody:
Brother Dornn,

Aye, yours is a most admirable goal and one that should be shared by all who
seek personal balance. It has been my view that one cannot acheive true
balance
when stained with the blood of our fellow civilized creatures; seek you, a
penance equal to the sins of your deeds, and balance may be yours. Be not
concerned with acquiring advancement or wealth at the expense of others. May
Quellious bring you strength and guidance in your times of need.

In Quellious' name,

Manjushri
Bearer of the yellow sash of the Ashen Order
(Fennin Ro)

At 09:59 AM 9/13/99 -0700, you wrote:
>From: "Scott Hueseman" <shueseman@...>
>
>
>Interesting idea, brother Manjushri. To advance to the highest levels of
>accomplishment, without taking the life of a human or demihuman (elf, dwarf,
>halfling, gnome). Alas, I've already slain a fair number of pirates and
>bandits, but I wonder if I can abstain from doing so for the remainder of my
>days? Truly a test worthy of a monk.
>
>Dornn, Level 17 Monk (Feign Death! Yeah, baby!), Brell Serilis, currently
>hunting Gargoyles in the Ocean of Tears.
